did.abstract: Professional collection of Dr. Harvey M. Rice, fifth President of SUNY Oswego from 1947 to 1952. In the postwar years, the administration of Harvey M. Rice kickstarted a period of ambitious yet sustained growth that also began to turn Oswego into a residential campus. Buildings opened during the Rice administration included our first residence halls (Lonis and Moreland) and student union (in what is now Mackin). Among other noteworthy accomplishments, under Riceâ€™s presidency, Oswego became a founding member of the SUNY system in 1948.

bioghist.p: Harvey M. Rice was born in Pinnacle, West Virginia on January 10, 1907. He received a B.A. in 1929 from Concord College and a M.A. from West Virginia University in 1933. He received his Ph.D. at Ohio State University in 1938. He taught in West Virginia high schools, Ohio State University, and New York State College for Teachers in Albany.
He was a lieutenant in the Naval Reserve during World War II.

He was a member of Pi Gamma Nx Mu and Alpha Phi Omega societies. Also, the American Historical Association, Southern Historical Association, New York State Historical Association, New York State Teachers Association, the New York Association of Teachers College faculties, the National Council for Social Studies, and the National Educational Association.
Dr. Rice was married to Dorothy Dillard and they had two sons.
Oswego State Teachers College inauguration - Friday, October 24, 1947. He served as president of the college from 1947 - 1951.

scopecontent.p: The papers of College President Dr. Harvey M. Rice consist of correspondence, memorandums, and copies of newspaper clippings. Subjects include cornerstone-laying, alumni recollections, requests for information, meetings, Dr. Mary V. Lee Scholarship Fund (totalled $5,629.22 in February 1951), the clock built by Uldrick Thompson, Dr, Rebecca Stoneroad's obituary (1885 Oswego Normal School graduate), letters between Dr. Rice and Governor Thomas E. Dewey, commencements, inauguration invitations, and seal of the college.

arrangement.p: Papers were gathered from throughout Special Collections' archives. Additional copies of newspaper clippings were added.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

2 letters, one typed and one handwritten to Dr. Dorothy Rogers, Professor of Psychology, State University of New York Teachers College.
October 7, 1959. From Dr. Harvey M. Rice, president of Macalester College, Saint Paul, Minnesota. Response to letter from Dr. Rogers concerning the history of the university and Dr. Rogers' upcoming book. Research. Dr. Rice lists several additional professional positions added, building construction, Splinter Village, Thomas Miller, Campus School, Master's Degree program in Elementary Education and Industrial Arts.
February 28 [1960?]. From Dorothy Rice (Mrs. Harvey M. Rice). Mrs. Rice is writing in response to Dr. Rogers' request for information about Dr. Rice's time as college president. She mentions that during a weekend snowstorm, Dr. Rice drove the college snow plow to clear their driveway.
